code-samples.name: JavaScript
TypeScript
code-samples.code:
const orderOut = await pay.order.create({
    provider: "telegram",
    wallet: "wallet",
    description: "My first order",
    uid: "unique-order-identifier",
    currency: "USDT",
    amount: "1"});

code-samples.name: Python
code-samples.code:
order_out = pay.order.create(OrderIn(
    provider="telegram",
    wallet="wallet",
    description="My first order",
    uid="unique-order-identifier",
    currency: "USDT",
    amount: "1"
), None)

code-samples.name: Python (Async)
code-samples.code:
order_out = await pay.order.create(OrderIn(
    provider="telegram",
    wallet="wallet",
    description="My first order",
    uid="unique-order-identifier",
    currency: "USDT",
    amount: "1"
), None)

code-samples.name: Go
code-samples.code:
orderOut, err := payClient.Order.Create(ctx, &OrderIn{
    Provider: "telegram",
    Wallet: "wallet",
    Description: "My first order",
    Uid: "unique-order-identifier",
    Currency: "USDT",
    Amount: "1"
})

code-samples.name: Kotlin
code-samples.code:
val orderOut = pay.order.create(OrderIn()
    .provider("telegram")
    .wallet("wallet")
    .description("My first order")
    .uid("unique-order-identifier")
    .currency("USDT")
    .amount("1")
)

code-samples.name: Java
code-samples.code:
OrderOut orderOut = pay.getOrder().create(new OrderIn()
    .provider("telegram")
    .wallet("wallet")
    .description("My first order")
    .uid("unique-order-identifier")
    .currency("USDT")
    .amount("1")
)

code-samples.name: Ruby
code-samples.code:
order_out = pay.order.create(Pay::OrderIn.new({
    "provider": "telegram",
    "wallet": "wallet",
    "description": "My first order",
    "uid": "unique-order-identifier",
    "currency": "USDT",
    "amount": "1"
}))

code-samples.name: Rust
C#
code-samples.code:
var orderOut = await pay.Order.CreateAsync(new OrderIn{
    provider: "telegram",
    wallet: "wallet",
    description: "My first order",
    uid: "unique-order-identifier",
    currency: "USDT",
    amount: "1"
})

code-samples.name: CLI
code-samples.code:
pay order create '{
    "provider": "telegram",
    "wallet": "wallet",
    "description": "My first order",
    "uid": "unique-order-identifier",
    "currency": "USDT",
    "amount": "1"
}'

code-samples.name: cURL
code-samples.code:
curl -X 'POST' \
  'https://api.pay.openweb3.io/api/v1/orders' \
  -H 'X-API-KEY: API_KEY' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
        "provider": "telegram",
        "wallet": "wallet",
        "description": "My first order",
        "uid": "unique-order-identifier",
        "currency": "USDT",
        "amount": "1"
    }'

ValidationError.description: Validation errors have their own schema to provide context for invalid requests eg. mismatched types and out of bounds values. There may be any number of these per 422 UNPROCESSABLE ENTITY error.

loc.description: The location as a [`Vec`] of [`String`]s -- often in the form `["body", "field_name"]`, `["query", "field_name"]`, etc. They may, however, be arbitrarily deep.

msg.description: The message accompanying the validation error item.

type.description: The type of error, often "type_error" or "value_error", but sometimes with more context like as "value_error.number.not_ge"

Ordering.description: Defines the ordering in a listing of results.

uid.description: Optional unique identifier for the order

amount.description: Big decimal string representation. Note that the max precision (number of digits after decimal point) depends on the currencyCode. E.g. for all fiat currencies is 2 (0.01), for BTC is 8, for USDT is 6. There's also min order amount for creating an order. It's 0.000001 BTC / 0.01 USDT / 0.01 USD / 0.01 EUR / 0.1 RUB.

Big decimal string representation. Note that the max precision (number of digits after decimal point) depends on the currencyCode. E.g. for all fiat currencies is 2 (0.01), for BTC is 8, for USDT is 6. There's also min order amount for creating an order. It's 0.000001 BTC / 0.01 USDT / 0.01 USD / 0.01 EUR / 0.1 RUB.

credentials.description: The payment token from payment channel

status.description:
The order's status
0 - processing
1 - paid
2 - failed
3 - canceled

amount.description: Big decimal string representation. Note that the max precision (number of digits after decimal point) depends on the currencyCode. E.g. for all fiat currencies is 2 (0.01), for BTC is 8, for USDT is 6. There's also min order amount for creating an order. It's 0.000001 BTC / 0.01 USDT / 0.01 USD / 0.01 EUR / 0.1 RUB.

network.description: The chain network monitor by endpoint

disabled.description: indicate whether to disable the webhook endpoint
